questions.text: Did the corporation agree to sell the bar back to Sam?
questions.explanation:
yes.

	Sam convinced them to sell him the bar but the cost was way more than he could afford. However, Sam was determined to save up the money.

questions.text: How much did Lilith give Frasier to invest?
questions.explanation:
$500.

	Frasier told Sam he was going to give him the $500. However, Sam said he couldn't take the money and Frasier was relieved because Lilith would not have been happy.

questions.text: How many security guards did Robin have?
questions.explanation:
12.

	Rebecca was very proud of the fact that people wanted to kill her boyfriend. When asked  who wanted to kill him Robin replied, "Who doesn't, really?"

questions.text: What was the name of Robin's boat?
questions.explanation:
"The Rebecca".

	Robin said he named his boat long before he met Rebecca. Rebecca however made a connection between the boat and herself saying the boat was named after the Biblical Rebekah. Then she said she had an aunt named Rebecca whom she was named after. She then stated, "and she was big as a boat and as old as the Bible".

questions.text: Who kept charging Rebecca to be quiet?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Robin was talking about his boat, but when applied to Rebecca it sounded dirty so Rebecca said to Carla "Not a word". Carla then agreed to be quiet when Rebecca offered her $5. Carla gave her the last one for free.

questions.text: Who told Robin, "I'm not a yutz!"?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam was going to ask Robin about sailing his boat in the boat race. He figured if he won he could keep the money, and Robin could have the trophy. He then went on to act out the dialogue based on what he thought Robin would say. One of the things he thought Robin would say was "Why should I let a yutz like you sail my boat?". Robin then comes out of the office and asked Sam if he'd like to sail the boat. Sam said yes and then yelled, "and I'm not a yutz!"

Norm and Carla.

	He could have had a few more people on his crew because Robin said earlier "You'll need a crew, Rebecca takes five men". This was one of the statements that Rebecca paid Carla $5 to keep quiet.

questions.text: What was on the boat that scared them?
questions.explanation:
a bomb.

	Norm went to get a beer from the fridge on the boat. He saw the bomb but thought it was one of those fancy devices to keep people out of the fridge.

questions.text: When Carla asked Sam about the dingy, how did Sam reply?
questions.correct: "That's what I'm going to miss most of all."
options: "Don't worry, Norm will be fine too."
questions.explanation:
"That's what I'm going to miss most of all."

	Leave it to Sam to be thinking about sex even during a crisis. Carla smacked him and told him she was referring to the little boat used for emergencies to get off the big boat.

questions.correct: He showed no concern and offered no apology.
options: He got a boat and Sam didn't.
He never paid him the money.
He was rich and Sam was poor.
questions.explanation:
He showed no concern and offered no apology.

	After the boat sank Robin never apologized for putting their lives in danger. He knew people wanted to kill him, so he should have checked the boat for safety before allowing anyone on it. Then, he acted like it was no big deal that the three of them were in danger.
